dict.string:
Once again, here I am.
I look back at the beach, remembering the time I spent there. The choices I made.
It makes me remember how things used to be. But, no. I can't think about that now. All I need to think about is surviving. Yeah. Not living. Living is thriving. Living is exhillerating!
I am survivng.
This little raft has served me well, but it will need to be replaced. This island had barely enough resources to even make a fire last night. I am going to just cross my fingers that I find more land soon.
One again, here I am. Setting out into the unknown.
Surviving.

It takes me a while, but I finally make it past the surf and into the break. The water is deep here. A beautiful shimmering grey.
I battle with myself. The island had barely any resources... But should I really gamble on whether I can make it to another island before this raft disintergrates?

Turning back seems like the only chance for survival, at this point.
I put my makeshift paddle in the water to the left of the raft, preparing to turn it around. I take one more look out to the sea, and then another look at the island.
It looks about 200m away, now. And I can see how small it really is.
I would last a day, maybe two.
That isn't survivng.
I decide, once again, that continuing is the only real option for me.

No matter how I try and justify staying, leaving always comes up as the best idea for survival.
I shake my head, take a deep breath, and remember my goal.
I put my makeshift paddle in the water. With each stroke, my mind pulls further from the island. I think less about the safety of staying, and think more about the uncertainty and excitement of the unknown.
Maybe I will find someone else. Someone like me.
